title: Amazing Arnold
brightcove_name: 100 Greatest Moments In Sports - No. 57 - Amazing Arnold
brightcove_short_desc: Heading into the final round of the 1960 U.S. Open, Arnold Palmer was seven shots back from the lead, tied for 15th place. Anybody counting him out was proven wrong.
brightcove_long_desc: Heading into the final round of the 1960 U.S. Open, Arnold Palmer was seven shots back from the lead, tied for 15th place. Anybody counting him out was proven wrong.
headline: Amazing Arnold
page_title: Arnold Palmer rallies to win 1960 U.S. Open
body: Heading into the final round of the 1960 U.S. Open, Arnold Palmer was seven shots back from the lead, tied for 15th place. Anybody counting him out was proven wrong, as Palmer finished with a six-under 65 on the day, beating 20-year-old amateur Jack Nicklaus by two strokes.
